test.name: Validate that I am able to add a Todo item

kw.name: Setup Test Environment
Run Keyword If
Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/writing-running-appium/server-args.md | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias | | strict_ssl | No | allows you to send commands to an invalid certificate host like a self-signed one. |

kw.arg: Setup Test Environment went wrong. Please check the value of the variable 'environmentToRunTest'.
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments, if ``condition`` is true.
Generic local test setup

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Get Element Attribute
kw.doc: Get element attribute using given attribute: name, value,...

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

kw.name: When I add a todo item titled
Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Get Element Attribute
kw.doc: Get element attribute using given attribute: name, value,...

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

kw.name: Input Text
kw.msg: Typing text 'Buy Groceries' into text field 'xpath=(//android.widget.EditText)[2]'
kw.doc: Types the given `text` into text field identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.doc: Click element identified by `locator`.

kw.name: Then The Todo item should be displayed as
Element Should Be Visible
kw.doc: Verifies that element identified with locator is visible.

kw.name: And The todo items count should be
Get the count of todo items
Get Element Attribute
kw.doc: Get element attribute using given attribute: name, value,...

kw.name: Extract Todo Count
kw.doc: Extracts the numeric todo count from the second line of the given counter_text. Assumes the text format is: todo-counter 0 items

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: And The Todo input field should be empty
Get Text
kw.doc: Get element text (for hybrid and mobile browser use `xpath` locator, others might cause problem)

kw.name: Should Be Empty
kw.doc: Verifies that the given item is empty.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.

kw.name: Get Length
kw.doc: Returns and logs the length of the given item as an integer.

kw.name: Then The todo items count should be
Get the count of todo items
Get Element Attribute
kw.doc: Get element attribute using given attribute: name, value,...

kw.name: Should Be Equal As Integers
kw.doc: Fails if objects are unequal after converting them to integers.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.

kw.doc: Generates a string with a desired ``length`` from the given ``chars``.

kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Then The empty state message should be displayed
Get Element Attribute
kw.msg: Element 'xpath=//android.view.View[contains(@content-desc, "empty-state")]' attribute 'content-desc' value 'empty-state No todos yet. Add one above!'
${actual_message} = empty-state No todos yet. Add one above!
kw.doc: Get element attribute using given attribute: name, value,...

kw.name: Should Contain
kw.doc: Fails if ``container`` does not contain ``item`` one or more times.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.
